marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Ray Augé is a Senior Software Architect focused on feature development and innovation. Since joining Liferay in 2005, his goal has been to increase ease of development without compromising creativity. Recently, he has prototyped and placed into production, a remote publishing, workflow-driven staging implementation complete with in-context preview, page versioning, website branching and rapid data modeling for application development. He has driven numerous improvements in areas such as permissioning, dynamic data models and metadata support, WCM, and Import/Export. He leads the charge for upcoming implementations of wRAD in Liferay. Raymond holds a B.S. in Computer Science from Laurentian University.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Karen Levy Newnam, Liferay's director of partner marketing, is a 15-year veteran of the IT channel who specializes in channel marketing, sales and operations development and infrastructure. 

In her role, Karen is responsible for mapping the direction of the company's global channel marketing strategy and for managing partner marketing worldwide.  

With experience from the partner, vendor and marketing services sides of the industry, Karen brings a unique perspective to Liferay's channel program. 

Karen’s diverse background includes tenure in the entertainment and advertising industries as well as eight years as an adjunct professor in public higher education.

In her spare time, Karen enjoys endurance running and laughing yoga.</Description></root>

sessions.titleCurrentValue: Guest Keynote

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Dr. Anthony (Tony) Murphy is director of The Global Learning and Observations to Benefit the Environment (GLOBE) Program Implementation Office (GIO) and is internationally known for his work in STEM education. Previously, Murphy served as Founding and Executive Director of the National Center for STEM Elementary Education at St. Catherine University in St. Paul, Minnesota.

Tony is proud of his association with the GLOBE Program, he first served the GLOBE Program at the White House in 1995. He notes that "Being involved at the ground level and working with scientists to create materials that would be used by teachers and students nationwide and globally was an incredible opportunity." Tony also served as a GLOBE education and training coordinator and received a promotion to deputy assistant director. "This was one of the most innovative programs at the time and having students, teachers and scientists working together on this type of science and education project was incredibly powerful." Twenty years on, it is amazing to see how far the Program has come and how far it is yet to go.

Join Dr. Tony Murphy's keynote to hear about NASA’s campaign to create “citizen scientists” during the recent solar eclipse.</Description></root>

Tony is proud of his association with the GLOBE Program, he first served the GLOBE Program at the White House in 1995. Tony also served as a GLOBE education and training coordinator and received a promotion to deputy assistant director. "This was one of the most innovative programs at the time and having students, teachers and scientists working together on this type of science and education project was incredibly powerful." Twenty years on, it is amazing to see how far the Program has come and how far it is yet to go.

Join Dr. Tony Murphy's keynote to hear about NASA’s campaign to create “citizen scientists” during the recent solar eclipse.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">JC works alongside various departments to identify and execute projects that improve the way Liferay operates. As a consultant at Accenture, JC managed several projects to improve operations for financial services firms, including GE Consumer Finance and Wachovia (now Wells Fargo). At Goldman Sachs, he advised technology and biotechnology clients on financings and mergers & acquisitions. JC has a B.E. in Mechanical Engineering from The Cooper Union, M.S. in Management Science & Engineering from Stanford, and an MBA from Wharton. When he’s not working or binge-watching Netflix, you can catch JC belting out 90’s pop music at the karaoke.</Description></root>

At Goldman Sachs, he advised technology and biotechnology clients on financings and mergers & acquisitions. JC has a B.E. in Mechanical Engineering from The Cooper Union, M.S. in Management Science & Engineering from Stanford, and an MBA from Wharton. When he’s not working or binge-watching Netflix, you can catch JC belting out 90’s pop music at the karaoke.

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Bob Burns is a Public Affairs Specialist and Social Media Lead. He joined the Transportation Security Administration’s (TSA) public affairs team in 2008 to help launch the agency’s social media presence. Known in some circles as “Blogger Bob,” he has become the face of TSA’s social media presence. Bob offers tips for getting through the checkpoint faster, commenting on stories in the press, or investigating and providing insights into “why” TSA has certain policies performs and procedures. His posts contain the perfect mix of fact and funny – artfully conveying important information in an entertaining fashion. Bob does an excellent job of leveraging his experience, personality, creativity, motivation, and commitment to help transform open government from promise to practice. Among many other accolades, Bob won a PRSA Bronze Anvil award in 2010 for the best blog campaign and Bob was recognized by the Washingtonian Magazine as one of Washington DC’s top 100 Tech Titans in 2011. Most recently, the TSA Instagram account was named the 4th best account to follow by Rolling Stone.

Bob's keynote will share the TSA’s successful strategy of using social content to help shape brand perception.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Ryan Schuhler is a UI Software Engineer who works as the lead UI architect for Liferay's Web Team. He works on Liferay.com and all its sub sites, maintaining the front-end code that goes into it as well as dabbling in the back-end. Day to day he works on anything from coding solutions for marketing's needs and strategies to building microsites for events (like this site). Ryan has an appreciation for cleanliness and efficiency when it comes to both code and user experience and is passionate about seeing these things implemented on liferay.com. He loves the unique opportunity to both use and contribute to Liferay's product and can see, first-hand, the benefits of having a well-developed, flexible website platform.</Description></root>

sessions.titleCurrentValue: Keynote

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Susan Ramirez founded Austin Angels in 2010 while working for the second largest homebuilder in the nation as a certified field trainer. Susan was nationally ranked as a top performing sales agent and was responsible for hiring, training and developing new hires. While working long hours in corporate America Susan felt a higher calling to lead her community in service and thus made a change in her career in 2015 to solely focus on moving the mission forward. Susan has a strong acumen for leadership development and executing nonprofit strategies and tactics. Susan believes that every child growing up in the foster care system should have the ability to reach their fullest potential. Susan’s dream is to have a chapter in every major metropolitan city across the nation and will not stop until every child is reached.

Susan's talk will show the power of community to create meaningful change in the local foster care system.</Description></root>

sessions.titleCurrentValue: Liferay DXP: Make Real Transformation Happen

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Carolina Moreno inició en el año 2000 su carrera en la operadora internacional Vodafone, donde trabajó durante varios años en distintos departamentos del área de ingeniería. A partir de 2005, su pasión por la tecnología como clave de transformación la llevó a coordinar diversos proyectos tecnológicos, tanto nacionales como internacionales, relacionados con la aplicación del software libre como motor de desarrollo económico y social. Durante este periodo, Moreno ejerció también como profesora asociada en el Grupo de Sistemas y Comunicaciones de la Universidad Rey Juan Carlos de Madrid, uno de los departamentos universitarios que, a través de su grupo Libresoft, es puntero en España en el estudio, difusión y desarrollo de proyectos Open Source. En 2009 entró a formar parte de Liferay, para ocupar el puesto de directora de desarrollo de negocio en Liferay España y Portugal. En 2012 asumió la Dirección General para este territorio y desde 2015, la Dirección General del Sur de Europa.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Sergio trabaja como ingeniero de soporte en Liferay desde junio de 2011. Su actividad se centra en resolver cuestiones orientadas a sistemas e infraestructura. Además de su trabajo habitual en soporte, a través de los servicios profesionales de Liferay se encarga de optimizar el rendimiento de las instalaciones de los clientes efectuando de pruebas de rendimiento in-situ en sus instalaciones. Sus intereses también pasan por aspectos como las técnicas de mejora de posicionamiento en buscadores (SEO) y la seguridad. Sergio es graduado en Ingeniería Informática por la Universidad de Salamanca.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">José Manuel lleva más de 15 años desarrollando productos de software para móviles, siendo CTO, director de desarrollo o arquitecto líder en distintas startup españolas y norteamericanas. En este tiempo, ha desarrollado desde herramientas de desarrollo, algoritmos de indexación y búsqueda para bases de datos textuales, software para tarjetas criptográficas, o juegos y aplicaciones desde los antiguos teléfonos Java. Desde su llegada a Liferay, lidera el equipo de Liferay Screens, desarrollando la siguiente generación de herramientas para desarrollo rápido de aplicaciones móviles. En su tiempo libre, José Manuel es profesor asociado en el máster de informática móvil y tarjetas inteligentes de la Universidad Pontificia de Salamanca.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Desde marzo de 2015, Fernando Carrión es director del área de Desarrollo de negocios Digitales para Ricoh IT Services. Entre sus funciones se encontrará la consolidación de la estrategia de comunicación digital de la compañía. Por otra parte es el responsable en búsquedas de nuevas áreas de negocio digital.  
Carrión ha desarrollado su carrera profesional en empresas como Yahoo, Director de Planificación y Estrategia;  Microsoft Ibérica, dando soporte al departamento comercial así como al departamento de marketing; Recoletos Compañía Editorial; en Terra Lycos Latinoamérica y España; y en The Media Edge.
Fernando Carrión es Licenciado en Publicidad y Relaciones Públicas por el Colegio Universitario  Domingo de Soto en Segovia  (adscrito a la  Universidad Complutense de Madrid.</Description></root>

<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Más de 10 años de experiencia como emprendedor en el sector IT.
En ZYLK, como CEO y Director de I+D, pionero en la transformación digital con Liferay, Alfresco, Pentaho, Valamis y otras soluciones líderes y, desde 2015, impulsando la industria 4.0, las smartcities y el BigData.
Dentro de la comunidad FLOSS, con Sinadura, como co-fundador y responsable de desarrollo de negocio y, como Presidente y Vicepresidente de ASOLIF y ESLE respectivamente, trabajando estrategias sectoriales, y asesorando en políticas públicas.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Sergio trabaja como ingeniero de soporte en Liferay desde junio de 2011. Su actividad se centra en resolver cuestiones orientadas a sistemas e infraestructura. Además de su trabajo habitual en soporte, a través de los servicios profesionales de Liferay se encarga de optimizar el rendimiento de las instalaciones de los clientes efectuando de pruebas de rendimiento in-situ en sus instalaciones. Sus intereses también pasan por aspectos como las técnicas de mejora de posicionamiento en buscadores (SEO) y la seguridad. Sergio es graduado en Ingeniería Informática por la Universidad de Salamanca.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Socio y gerente de negocios, marketing y alianzas en Bitergia y apasionado de las comunidades de código abierto.
 Después de graduarse como ingeniero industrial y de haber empezado el doctorado en informática, ha trabajado en el Centro Tecnológico de Informática y Comunicaciones del Principado de Asturias, participando en grupos de trabajo del W3C. Posteriormente director de innovación en Ándago Engineering, tras gestional el de innovación de área de salud y bienestar y ser co-responsable del grupo técnico de Continua Health Alliance.
 Después de un breve período como CEO de una start-up y como consultor especializado en proyectos empresariales relacionados con el mundo del software libre colaborando con CENATIC y ASOLIF se unió a Bitergia en 2013.
 Participante en varias comunidades relacionadas con el software libre como Maemo/Meego, Mozilla Madrid, Google Developers Group, etc.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">José Manuel lleva más de 15 años desarrollando productos de software para móviles, siendo CTO, director de desarrollo o arquitecto líder en distintas startup españolas y norteamericanas. En este tiempo, ha desarrollado desde herramientas de desarrollo, algoritmos de indexación y búsqueda para bases de datos textuales, software para tarjetas criptográficas, o juegos y aplicaciones desde los antiguos teléfonos Java. Desde su llegada a Liferay, lidera el equipo de Liferay Screens, desarrollando la siguiente generación de herramientas para desarrollo rápido de aplicaciones móviles. En su tiempo libre, José Manuel es profesor asociado en el máster de informática móvil y tarjetas inteligentes de la Universidad Pontificia de Salamanca.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Juan Gigli es argentino y licenciado en Ciencia Política. Se estableció en España en 2004 y a lo largo de estos años ha trabajado en diferentes empresas de marketing digital (Cabestan, CheetahDigital, Salesforce) especialmente en la disciplina del email marketing. En todos estos años ha gestionado exitosamente largos y complejos ciclos de ventas en el segmento empresarial en el mercado español en diferentes industrias. Posteriormente ha participado en proyectos en grandes integradores como Accenture o Capgemini. En marzo de 2017 se une a Liferay para impulsar el uso de esta plataforma en el mercado español y portugués.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Licenciada en Comunicación Audiovisual y en Periodismo por la Universidad de Navarra y PDD del IESE Business School, inicia su actividad profesional en 1997 como periodista en varios medios de comunicación, entre los que destacan El Mundo, The Miami Herald, Telecinco y Europa Press.
Tras cinco años como Directora de Comunicación de la Confederación de Empresarios de Pontevedra, en 2007 pone en marcha su propia compañía, MundiNova Consultores de Comunicación, referente del sector en el noroeste peninsular, desarrollando estrategias de comunicación corporativa y de producto, principalmente en áreas de consumo, banca, energía, tecnología y sectores empresariales. Lo compagina con la dirección del Portal Innovamás y del Anuario de la Innovación en Galicia. Desde abril de 2016 es la Directora de Comunicación de Nueva Pescanova.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Iván es Ingeniero Informático por la Universidad Autónoma de Madrid y ha dedicado su carrera profesional al desarrollo de software, tanto formando parte de empresas, como siendo autónomo.

Su principal área profesional siempre fue Java, pero nunca ha dejado de lado el frontend ni el desarrollo móvil en sus ratos libres, razón por la que, en su nueva etapa en Liferay, ha decidido dar el salto profesional y convertirse en desarrollador de infraestructura front.

Actualmente se encarga del desarrollo de la infraestructura Javascript del portal, lo que incluye las herramientas de construcción de proyectos y el despliegue de código Javascript.</Description></root>
marketingEventUsers.descriptionCurrentValue:
Iván es Ingeniero Informático por la Universidad Autónoma de Madrid y ha dedicado su carrera profesional al desarrollo de software, tanto formando parte de empresas, como siendo autónomo.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Ho iniziato il mio viaggio nel mondo dell'informatica da un Olivetti M24 dotato di un processore Intel 8086 acquistato da mio padre esclusivamente per il suo lavoro. Non ho mai posseduto console di nessun genere (Commodore, Amiga, etc…) e inizialmente quell'enorme scatola mi terrorizzava, terrore durato poco; giorno dopo giorno prendevo rapidamente il controllo fino a quando… Ho sempre creduto che la condivisione della conoscenza sia un ottimo mezzo per la crescita personale e questo è stato uno dei principali motivi che mi ha spinto sei anni fa a creare il mio blog personale www.dontesta.it. Dicono di me che sono bravo nell'analizzare e risolvere rapidamente i problemi complessi. La mia attività odierna è quella di consulente in progetti enterprise che utilizzano tecnologie Web Oriented come J2EE, Web Services, ESB, TIBCO.</Description></root>
marketingEventUsers.descriptionCurrentValue: Ho iniziato il mio viaggio nel mondo dell'informatica da un Olivetti M24 dotato di un processore Intel 8086 acquistato da mio padre esclusivamente per il suo lavoro. Dicono di me che sono bravo nell'analizzare e risolvere rapidamente i problemi complessi. La mia attività odierna è quella di consulente in progetti enterprise che utilizzano tecnologie Web Oriented come J2EE, Web Services, ESB, TIBCO.

<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Nel 2005 inizia la sua carriera nel mondo IT, si appassiona presto al coding specializzandosi principalmente sulla piattaforma J2EE. Negli anni contribuisce alla realizzazione di numerose soluzioni informatiche, in diversi ambiti e per diverse realtà aziendali. 
Nel 2011 Davide incontra Liferay grazie alla collaborazione in un progetto per le Nazione Unite, da allora intraprende un percorso di specializzazione su Liferay che lo porta all'incontro con SMC, dove da tre anni svolge il ruolo di Senior Liferay Developer e Team Leader.</Description></root>
marketingEventUsers.descriptionCurrentValue:

Nel 2011 Davide incontra Liferay grazie alla collaborazione in un progetto per le Nazione Unite, da allora intraprende un percorso di specializzazione su Liferay che lo porta all'incontro con SMC, dove da tre anni svolge il ruolo di Senior Liferay Developer e Team Leader.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Affascinato dall'informatica fin dall'infanzia, già nei primi anni delle superiori Mauro inizia il suo percorso cimentandosi con i primi linguaggi di programmazione. Conseguita la laurea in scienze informatiche, comincia la sua carriera nel mondo dello sviluppo accumulando esperienza soprattutto su Java J2EE, ma allo stesso tempo coltivando conoscenze e curiosità nei confronti del front-end e della parte sistemistica. Una volta conosciuto Liferay ne rimane colpito e decide di specializzarsi, proprio durante questa fase di approfondimento viene in contatto con SMC dove è ad oggi un Liferay full-stack developer.</Description></root>

<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Nel 2005 inizia la sua carriera nel mondo IT, si appassiona presto al coding specializzandosi principalmente sulla piattaforma J2EE. Negli anni contribuisce alla realizzazione di numerose soluzioni informatiche, in diversi ambiti e per diverse realtà aziendali. 
Nel 2011 Davide incontra Liferay grazie alla collaborazione in un progetto per le Nazione Unite, da allora intraprende un percorso di specializzazione su Liferay che lo porta all'incontro con SMC, dove da tre anni svolge il ruolo di Senior Liferay Developer e Team Leader.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Dopo la laurea in Ingegneria Elettronica all'Università di Pavia, inizia da subito a sviluppare per il web e nel 1995 fonda, insieme al socio Ricotti, Ariadne, società di web engineering focalizzata sullo sviluppo di piattaforme digitali con approccio basato su metodologie di sviluppo software lean-agile. In pochi anni la società cresce e diventa leader di mercato vantando referenze di prestigio a livello europeo e un team di più di 50 persone. Si interessa di vari argomenti legati alle architetture ICT e approfondisce le problematiche di sicurezza con una successiva laurea in Sicurezza dei Sistemi e delle Reti presso l’Università di Milano. Sempre curioso e informato sui temi dell'innovazione tecnologica, Torriani si divide tra il lavoro, la famiglia e l'altra sua grande passione: la fotografia.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Ingegnere informatico e dottore di ricerca, si specializza negli ambiti dell'intelligenza artificiale e del ragionamento automatico, con particolare riferimento alle tecnologie del Semantic Web sulle quali pubblica decine di articoli scientifici su riviste del settore. marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Depuis plus de 10 ans au service de la croissance des entreprises de la région Ile de France, mon expérience professionnelle m’a donné l’occasion de travailler dans les deux champs d’expertise qui bousculent les modèles de développement d’entreprise de ces dernières années : le développement durable et le numérique. Aujourd’hui responsible de service marketing, j’ai eu l’occasion de contribuer à plusieurs projets web d’envergure autour de ces deux thématiques et plus largement sur la présentation de l’offre de services de la CCI Paris Ile de France.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Bryan Cheung est l'un des fondateurs de l'entreprise depuis sa création en 2004 et dirige l'orientation stratégique de la société dans le monde entier et le développement commercial. S'appuyant sur son expérience technique, la compréhension des besoins des clients, et une passion pour les utilisateurs finaux, Bryan définit les orientations stratégiques de Liferay afin de respecter son engagement à fournir des solutions Business ciblées et efficaces à ses clients et sa communauté. Bryan est diplômé de l'Université de Californie, Berkeley, avec un diplôme en informatique. Bryan est un conférencier recherché dans les grands événements IT et de l'industrie Open Source.</Description></root>

sessions.titleCurrentValue: Guest Keynote

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Vijay Gurbaxani is the Founding Director of the Center for Digital Transformation and the Taco Bell endowed Professor of Business and Computer Science at the Paul Merage School of Business, University of California, Irvine.  <br>
<br>

His research, teaching and consulting interests are at the intersection of business strategy and information technology (IT). 

Vijay has extensive experience in management education and advisory services, having lectured worldwide, taught extensively in degree and executive programs, and consulted for and provided research expertise to Fortune 500 companies, technology service providers, and consulting firms.  He has authored the book, “Managing Information Systems Costs,” and published numerous articles in premier academic journals.

He has served as Senior Associate Dean for Academic Affairs and as Associate Dean of MBA programs.  He led the development of a new strategic focus on the transformative role of IT in business, which led to widespread recognition of the school as a center of excellence in IT.

Dr. Gurbaxani received a Master's degree in Mathematics and Computer Science from the Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay.  He received his Ph.D. from the Simon School of Business, University of Rochester.  His thesis won the best dissertation prize in a worldwide competition.</Description></root>
marketingEventUsers.descriptionCurrentValue:
Vijay Gurbaxani is the Founding Director of the Center for Digital Transformation and the Taco Bell endowed Professor of Business and Computer Science at the Paul Merage School of Business, University of California, Irvine.

His research, teaching and consulting interests are at the intersection of business strategy and information technology (IT). Vijay has extensive experience in management education and advisory services, having lectured worldwide, taught extensively in degree and executive programs, and consulted for and provided research expertise to Fortune 500 companies, technology service providers, and consulting firms. He has authored the book, “Managing Information Systems Costs,” and published numerous articles in premier academic journals. He has served as Senior Associate Dean for Academic Affairs and as Associate Dean of MBA programs. He led the development of a new strategic focus on the transformative role of IT in business, which led to widespread recognition of the school as a center of excellence in IT. Dr. Gurbaxani received a Master's degree in Mathematics and Computer Science from the Indian Institute of Technology, Bombay. He received his Ph.D. from the Simon School of Business, University of Rochester. His thesis won the best dissertation prize in a worldwide competition.

During the years, Mika has helped organizations of all sizes in their digital transformation of learning, translating the customers’ voice to the product development team of Valamis - Learning Experience Platform. marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Mika Kuikka is one of the co-founders of Valamis and an online learning enthusiast. During the years, Mika has helped organizations of all sizes in their digital transformation of learning, translating the customers’ voice to the product development team of Valamis - Learning Experience Platform. In 2008, Mika earned a master’s degree in Computer Sciences (software engineering, computer-aided learning and marketing) from the University of Joensuu, Finland (now known as University of Eastern Finland). He looks forward to the future of the online learning supported by intuitive learning solutions, transparent learning processes, knowledge mapping and training with virtual or augmented reality.</Description></root>

sessions.titleCurrentValue: Transforming and Modernizing the American Quarter Horse Association Using Liferay DXP as the Catalyst

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Andrew Doak consults at all stages of the software design lifecycle (SDLC), working with members of the requirements (business analysts & modelers), marketing and design, development, quality assurance, and delivery teams to ensure the finished solution is aligned with user needs.

He has managed teams of 30+ hybrid user experience designer/developers based out of the US, India, Philippines, Mexico, Canada, and England who supported multiple clients, both internal and external.

Most recently, Andrew Doak led a strategy and roadmap engagement for the American Quarter Horse Association as part of AQHA's plans to transform and modernize their digital channels including a complete redesign of AQHA.com using Liferay DXP. The new Liferay DXP platform will deliver a personalized digital experience for 250.000 registered AQHA Members and over one million visitors to the new website. AQHA will be using the platform to deliver a series of marketing campaigns to convert visitors to Members and provide added value to their Corporate Sponsors who promote their Brands through AQHA.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Greg is the lead engineer for the Liferay tooling team, which is responsible for tools such as Liferay Developer Studio, Blade CLI, and Liferay Workspace. For the past 8 years, he has been helping Liferay developers become more productive by building IDE plugins for Eclipse or Intellij (newly released!), command-line tools such as Blade, and CI/toolchain plugins for Gradle and Maven. Liferay's heterogenous development model can be intimidating, with OSGi modules, WAR-style plugins, theme development, and now front-end/npm-based projects. Greg embraces this complexity so Liferay developers don't have to; they can just focus on building great products. Greg holds a M.S. in Computer Systems Engineering from the University of Arkansas, US.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Ryan Schuhler is a UI Software Engineer who works as the lead UI architect for Liferay's Webteam. He works on Liferay.com and all its sub sites, maintaining the front-end code that goes into it as well as dabbling in the back-end. Day to day he works on anything from coding solutions for marketing's needs and strategies to building microsites for events (like this site). Ryan has an appreciation for cleanliness and effeciency when it comes to both code and user experience and is passionate about seeing these things implemented on liferay.com. He loves the unique opportunity to both use and contribute to Liferay's product and can see, first-hand, the benefits of having a well developed, flexible portal software.</Description></root>

sessions.titleCurrentValue: Guest Keynote

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">In 2002, Michael and Carol Hart founded ZOE International a 501(c)3 nonprofit. They were living comfortably in Southern California with a successful business in the Motion Picture Industry for 14 years when they heard about child trafficking. Everything changed for them. They prayed and asked God how they could help.

They sold their custom-designed home and everything they had and moved to Thailand to begin working to help end the human trafficking of children. Shortly thereafter, Carol gave away her 6-carat diamond wedding ring to raise more funds to help more children.

ZOE’s main campus is located in Thailand where they live. For over 15 years, ZOE has fought the human trafficking of children and protected orphans at risk. They have developed innovative prevention and rescue solutions as an NGO (Non-Governmental Organization) serving in this arena. They have seen extraordinary outcomes in the restoration of the children they have rescued who are able to move forward with restored hope and new direction. They provide prosecution preparation for rescued children and protective services. Because of their outstanding anti-trafficking work, ZOE has been recipients of several government awards and ongoing opportunities to work closely with both Law Enforcement and Social Welfare multi-disciplinary task forces. Their main focus as they fight this global atrocity is looking for long term solutions that will serve and protect vulnerable children, families, and communities in any country.
 
They have operations-offices in Los Angeles-USA, Thailand, Australia, Japan, and were recently awarded their anti-trafficking legal status to serve in Mexico.</Description></root>
marketingEventUsers.descriptionCurrentValue:
In 2002, Michael and Carol Hart founded ZOE International a 501(c)3 nonprofit. They were living comfortably in Southern California with a successful business in the Motion Picture Industry for 14 years when they heard about child trafficking. Everything changed for them. They prayed and asked God how they could help.

They sold their custom-designed home and everything they had and moved to Thailand to begin working to help end the human trafficking of children. Shortly thereafter, Carol gave away her 6-carat diamond wedding ring to raise more funds to help more children.

ZOE’s main campus is located in Thailand where they live. For over 15 years, ZOE has fought the human trafficking of children and protected orphans at risk. They have developed innovative prevention and rescue solutions as an NGO (Non-Governmental Organization) serving in this arena. They have seen extraordinary outcomes in the restoration of the children they have rescued who are able to move forward with restored hope and new direction. They provide prosecution preparation for rescued children and protective services. Because of their outstanding anti-trafficking work, ZOE has been recipients of several government awards and ongoing opportunities to work closely with both Law Enforcement and Social Welfare multi-disciplinary task forces. Their main focus as they fight this global atrocity is looking for long term solutions that will serve and protect vulnerable children, families, and communities in any country.
 
They have operations-offices in Los Angeles-USA, Thailand, Australia, Japan, and were recently awarded their anti-trafficking legal status to serve in Mexico.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Carolina Moreno inició en el año 2000 su carrera en la operadora internacional Vodafone, donde trabajó durante varios años en distintos departamentos del área de ingeniería. A partir de 2005, su pasión por la tecnología como clave de transformación la llevó a coordinar diversos proyectos tecnológicos, tanto nacionales como internacionales, relacionados con la aplicación del software libre como motor de desarrollo económico y social. Durante este periodo, Moreno ejerció también como profesora asociada en el Grupo de Sistemas y Comunicaciones de la Universidad Rey Juan Carlos de Madrid, uno de los departamentos universitarios que, a través de su grupo Libresoft, es puntero en España en el estudio, difusión y desarrollo de proyectos Open Source. En 2009 entró a formar parte de Liferay, para ocupar el puesto de directora de desarrollo de negocio en Liferay España y Portugal. En 2012 asumió la Dirección General para este territorio y a partir de este año, 2018, asimió la Vice Presidencia de Ventas de EMEA.</Description></root>

Sergio es graduado en Ingeniería Informática por la Universidad de Salamanca.</Description></root>

sessions.titleCurrentValue: Experiencias del Instituto de Salud Carlos III con Liferay

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">investigador en el área de “Plataformas y Tecnologías” de la Unidad de Investigación en Telemedicina y eSalud del Instituto de Salud Carlos III (ISCIII). Ha participado en 6 proyectos europeos (Joint Action CHRODIS, FP7, FP6,  e-TEN) y más de 10 proyectos nacionales (FIS, CENIT, AVANZA). Tiene más de 35 publicaciones y participaciones en congresos. Es profesor en el "Máster en Dirección de Sistemas y Tecnologías de la Información y las Comunicaciones para la Salud" (2014-2018) organizado por la Sociedad Española de Informática para la Salud (SEIS), la Escuela Nacional de Sanidad (ENS) y el ISCIII, y ha sido profesor asociado en la Universidad de Alcalá (2004 - 2013) impartiendo docencia en el departamento de Ciencias de la Computación. Santiago tiene Estudios Avanzados de Doctorado (DEA) por la Universidad de Alcalá,  es Ingeniero en Informática por la UNED e Ingeniero Técnico en Informática de Gestión por la Universidad Politécnica de Madrid.  Sus áreas de interés incluyen: plataformas web, software open-source, e-learning, sensores biomédicos y medioambientales, dispositivos móviles, integración de arquitecturas e ingeniería del software.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Jorge es Head of Experience Design en Everis pero sus orígenes están en el área del periodismo y el diseño gráfico. Comenzó su trayectoria en el mundo de la comunicación digital pasando por lo visual y un bien día aterrizó en el estudio del usuario para, finalmente, quedarse en el diseño de experiencias. A lo largo de su carrera ha tenido la oportunidad de participar en diferentes proyectos de diseño de interacción multi dispositivo, así como la creación de potentes interfaces de usuario y el objetivo ha sido siempre, para él, presentar el contenido de una manera clara y útil.  También está involucrado en proyectos de innovación para los negocios en línea, donde disfruta explorando las oportunidades del mundo digital e investigando la mente del usuario. Así mismo, compagina todo esto con el mundo académico colaborando como profesor y tutor de grado y master en escuelas de diseño como IED, ESDI, LCI, Elisava y la Salle.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description:
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Jaime Coll es un consultor de transformación digital con más de 25 años de experiencia, completando una visión general de las necesidades de los negocios en su aproximación digital, obteniendo una visión tanto estratégica como táctica.

En el diseño de los procesos de (r)evolución de las empresas siempre intenta conjugar las palancas de negocio (eficacia, crecimiento y conocmiento) con una base tecnológica que acelere y facilita el proceso de llegada al mercado, poniendo al usuario final en el centro del diseño de las experiencias a través de talleres de innovación y descubrimiento.

 Durante esta última etapa se centra en la definición de productos y servicios, transformando ideas de negocio en experiencias reales, medibles y rentables, con una carga elevada de innovación y modernidad, a través del diseño de servicios, y siempre basado en la justificación e interpretación de los datos.</Description></root>
marketingEventUsers.descriptionCurrentValue:
Jaime Coll es un consultor de transformación digital con más de 25 años de experiencia, completando una visión general de las necesidades de los negocios en su aproximación digital, obteniendo una visión tanto estratégica como táctica.

En el diseño de los procesos de (r)evolución de las empresas siempre intenta conjugar las palancas de negocio (eficacia, crecimiento y conocmiento) con una base tecnológica que acelere y facilita el proceso de llegada al mercado, poniendo al usuario final en el centro del diseño de las experiencias a través de talleres de innovación y descubrimiento.

 Durante esta última etapa se centra en la definición de productos y servicios, transformando ideas de negocio en experiencias reales, medibles y rentables, con una carga elevada de innovación y modernidad, a través del diseño de servicios, y siempre basado en la justificación e interpretación de los datos.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">José Manuel lleva más de 15 años desarrollando productos de software para móviles, siendo CTO, director de desarrollo o arquitecto líder en distintas startup españolas y norteamericanas. En este tiempo, ha desarrollado desde herramientas de desarrollo, algoritmos de indexación y búsqueda para bases de datos textuales, software para tarjetas criptográficas, o juegos y aplicaciones desde los antiguos teléfonos Java. Desde su llegada a Liferay, lidera el equipo de Liferay Screens, desarrollando la siguiente generación de herramientas para desarrollo rápido de aplicaciones móviles. En su tiempo libre, José Manuel es profesor asociado en el máster de informática móvil y tarjetas inteligentes de la Universidad Pontificia de Salamanca.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">José has worked in everis from 2005, with a strong background in Digital Experience related projects. He's been working in Liferay projects from 2010 for top Global and European organizations from diverse sectors: Banking, Public sector, Agrochemical and biotechnology, Automotive, and Insurance among others. During this time he's helped these organizations to make the most out of the huge set of Liferay capabilities either for Intranets, Public facing websites, Single Access Point platforms, Mobile apps and Headless CMS. José's currently involved in innovative initiatives involving new channels (Chatbots, VR/AR, Robots, etc.) having Liferay as Centralized Digital Experience Platform. José holds a Systems Engineering degree from the Universidad de Oriente, Venezuela.</Description></root>

sessions.titleCurrentValue: Closing Keynote

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Carolina Moreno inició en el año 2000 su carrera en la operadora internacional Vodafone, donde trabajó durante varios años en distintos departamentos del área de ingeniería. A partir de 2005, su pasión por la tecnología como clave de transformación la llevó a coordinar diversos proyectos tecnológicos, tanto nacionales como internacionales, relacionados con la aplicación del software libre como motor de desarrollo económico y social. Durante este periodo, Moreno ejerció también como profesora asociada en el Grupo de Sistemas y Comunicaciones de la Universidad Rey Juan Carlos de Madrid, uno de los departamentos universitarios que, a través de su grupo Libresoft, es puntero en España en el estudio, difusión y desarrollo de proyectos Open Source. En 2009 entró a formar parte de Liferay, para ocupar el puesto de directora de desarrollo de negocio en Liferay España y Portugal. En 2012 asumió la Dirección General para este territorio y a partir de este año, 2018, asimió la Vice Presidencia de Ventas de EMEA.</Description></root>

<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US,it_IT," default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Laureato in Ingegneria Informatica, ha oltre 10 anni di esperienza nella progettazione e realizzazione di web application e portali realizzati con tecnologie java e di piattaforme e-learning.  
Negli ultimi 8 anni si è specializzato nell’utilizzo di Liferay, con particolare interesse per portali di integrazione di sistemi aziendali legacy attraverso la realizzazione di plugin custom e altre personalizzazioni del core a partire dalla versione 5.1 di Liferay fino alle più recenti versioni.  Ha seguito in qualità di Project Manager progetti per grandi clienti come Artemide, London Stock Exchange, Engie, Sisal, Banca Patrimoni Sella, ecc.</Description><Description language-id="it_IT">Laureato in Ingegneria Informatica, ha oltre 10 anni di esperienza nella progettazione e realizzazione di web application e portali realizzati con tecnologie java e di piattaforme e-learning.

marketingEventUsers.descriptionCurrentValue: Dopo la laurea in Economia conseguita presso l'Università degli Studi di Trieste e un Master in Business & Administration in Bocconi, Cesare Mottola de Nordis inizia la sua carriera nella consulenza per poi ricoprire la posizione di Chief Information Officer in grandi aziende industriali e di servizi, prima di approdare in Candy Hoover Group nel 2002. In questi anni si è occupato di armonizzare e sviluppare il parco applicativo per renderlo utilizzabile da tutte le 40 società del gruppo su un perimetro geografico che comprende, oltre all’Europa, la Cina la Turchia e la Russia. Oggi coordina un gruppo di 50 collaboratori interni; gestisce un budget annuale di 10 Mil di Euro.

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Eduardo Lundgren is the engineering lead for Liferay Cloud, a newly created Liferay division. Acting as the Engineering Director until 2015, he was responsible for running a multi-disciplinary team and for kicking-off many successful projects, such as WeDeploy, Tracking.JS and Metal.JS. sessions.titleCurrentValue: The Journey of a Liferay Developer: The Search for Answers

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Five time Liferay Top Contributor Award recipient Andrew Jardine is an independent Liferay consultant and active member of the Liferay community. With almost 10 years of Liferay experience, Andrew has successfully delivered more than a dozen projects for organizations, large and small, in North America. Andrew's contributions to Liferay span multiple versions of the product, from 5.x through to 7.x. A self-proclaimed "Unofficial Liferay Evangelist", he works tirelessly to help others see the beauty of the product as he tries to help them leverage Liferay's many features to deliver simple, modern, and future proof solutions. Andrew is a true Liferay geek. He enjoys sharing his experiences with Liferay and hearing about the amazing things other developers have done with the product. When he's not up to his ears in Liferay code, he spends most of his time cleaning up after his kids, and, every now and then, manages to get out onto the trails with his Mountain Bike.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Nicola Legittimo ist Business Solutions Lead Digital im Bereich Business Solutions & Corporate Projects bei der Hays AG. Er ist verantwortlich für alle Front-Office-Lösungen von Hays in Deutschland, Österreich und der Schweiz. Neben der Koordination des Anforderungsmanagements für diese Lösungen, an der Schnittstelle zwischen Business und IT, ist er für die funktionale Weiterentwicklung des Hays Portals sowie aller Lösungen im Webumfeld, die Toolauswahl und das Lifecycle Management zuständig. Herr Legittimo verfügt über 20 Jahre Erfahrung mit beruflichen Stationen als eBusiness Berater und Projektleiter bei IBM Global Services und Business Excellence Manager ISIT / Account Manager bei Nestle in Frankfurt.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Moritz Hellwig ist studierter Sprachwissenschaftler und Japanologe. Durch die Beteiligung an dem Forschungsprojekt MultilingualWeb-LT wurde sein Interesse an IT-nahen Themen geweckt. Im Jahr 2015 schloss sich Herr Hellwig der USU GmbH als Projektleiter an. Seit 2016 leitet er das aus 10 Mitarbeitern bestehende Team Delta und ist verantwortlich für diverse Großprojekte wie den Relaunch der Konrad Adenauer Stiftung, die kontinuierliche Weiterentwicklung diverser technischer Plattformen bei der Flughafengesellschaft Berlin Brandenburg sowie diverser Projekte im Bereich Finance/Insurance.</Description></root>

marketingEventUsers.description: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Als UX-Visual Designerin liegt der Schwerpunkt von Elisa Litty in der grafischen Ausgestaltung von Benutzeroberflächen. Durch die praktische Anwendung von psychologischen und physiologischen Aspekten werden diese wissenschaftlich fundiert ausgearbeitet, um die Interaktion mit dem System zu erleichtern, während Ästhetik zum positiven Erleben von Produkt und Marke beiträgt. Innerhalb ihres Studiums zur Ingenieurin für Druck- und Medientechnik spezialisierte sich Elisa Litty auf die Themen UX/UI-Design, Usability und Barrierefreiheit. Seit Oktober 2017 ist sie für Unymira tätig und begleitet unter anderem Projekte, wie die Neuausrichtung des Onlineauftritts der Konrad-Adenauer-Stiftung und für weitere Kunden, wie VDEK – die Ersatzkassen, die IHK und Fiducia & GAD.</Description></root>

<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><root available-locales="en_US" default-locale="en_US"><Description language-id="en_US">Adrian Johnson is the General Manager of Liferay Australia and New Zealand. 

Adrian started his career as an Officer in the Royal Australian Navy and since then has led businesses in Australia, Asia and the United States including Dell, Fuji Xerox, Sun Microsystems and Code42.</Description></root>
marketingEventUsers.descriptionCurrentValue:
Adrian Johnson is the General Manager of Liferay Australia and New Zealand. 

Adrian started his career as an Officer in the Royal Australian Navy and since then has led businesses in Australia, Asia and the United States including Dell, Fuji Xerox, Sun Microsystems and Code42.
